snippet: As clashes between demonstrators and security forces continued in and near Cairo, the Egyptian government threatened to block entrances to a large protest camp.
abstract: Egyptian government threatens to block entrances to large protest camp where supporters of ousted Pres Mohamed Morsi have been calling for his return.

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and MICHAEL R. GORDON
byline.contributor: Ben Hubbard reported from Cairo, and Michael R. Gordon from London.

lead_paragraph: As clashes between demonstrators and security forces continued in and near Cairo, the Egyptian government threatened to block entrances to a large protest camp.

headline.main: Egypt Says It May Shut Entrances to Camps
headline.print_headline: Egypt Says It May Shut Entrances To Camps

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
